meanings.sent1: The garbage left a niffy odor in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The old socks were quite niffy.
meanings.sent3: The niffy cheese made everyone in the room wrinkle their noses.
meanings.sent4: The alley behind the restaurant was a niffy tunnel of stench.
meanings.sent5: The niffy smell of rotten eggs lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: To emit a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The trash can niffied the whole room.
meanings.sent2: The flowers niffy when they start to wilt.
meanings.sent3: The skunk niffied the entire neighborhood with its spray.
meanings.sent4: The sewer grate niffied the street with its foul odor.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled milk niffied the fridge as soon as it was opened.
